intro: Loranthus kerrii, commonly known as Kerri's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the Loranthaceae family. It grows on a variety of host trees, primarily in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces white or yellowish flowers that are often clustered together. Its berries are typically red or orange, containing seeds that are dispersed by birds. Loranthus kerrii plays an important ecological role by providing food for various animals and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
